text: Paul Adrian Devine (December 2, 1951 â€“ June 27, 2020) was an American baseball pitcher. He played seven seasons in Major League Baseball (MLB). He played for the Atlanta Braves and Texas Rangers from 1973 until 1980. He batted and threw right-handed and was a relief pitcher. He was born in Galveston, Texas. Devine survived tongue cancer twice. He died from brain and lung cancer on June 27, 2020 at the age of 68. ==References== Category:1951 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from brain cancer Category:Deaths from lung cancer Category:Atlanta Braves players Category:Texas Rangers players Category:People from Galveston, Texas Category:Sportspeople from Texas
title: Adrian Devine
